list.title: PORT
list.description: The port on which the server will listen.

list.title: app
list.description: Creates an Express application.

list.title: express
list.description: Module dependencies.

list.title: globalHelpers
list.description:
This module provides a set of helper functions for:

  • Generating random numbers and strings
  • Creating strong passwords
  • Generating valid Gmail usernames

list.title:
globalHelpers
Find all reCAPTCHA clients on the current page.findRecaptchaClients
globalHelpers.formatBirthday
list.description: Format a birthday object into "DD-MM-YYYY" format.

list.title: globalHelpers.generateStrongPassword
list.description: Generate a strong password with a random length between minLength and maxLength. The password includes uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters.

list.title: globalHelpers.generateUsername
list.description:
Generate a valid Gmail username based on the provided first and last names. If both names are unavailable, it falls back to a random username.

  • The generated username may include dots (.) randomly.
  • A random suffix (3-8 characters) is appended for uniqueness.
  • A random number (0-9999) is added to prevent duplicates.
  • If both first and last names are missing, the username is purely random.
  • Ensures the username is at least 12 characters long.

list.title: globalHelpers.getRandomFromArray
list.description: Get a random element from an array. Throws an error if the input is not a non-empty array.

list.title: globalHelpers.randomNumber
list.description: Generate a random number between min and max (inclusive). Automatically handles cases where min > max.

list.title: globalHelpers.randomString
list.description: Generate a random string of the given length. Uses a default set of alphanumeric characters.

list.title: globalHelpers.refactorTextAreaMessage
list.description: Function can refactor message to handle text area input.

list.title: globalHelpers.shuffleArrayHelper
list.description: Function can shuffle array.

list.title: globalHelpers.trackingRequestDate
list.description: Tracking Date Format (Start Tracking Request)

list.title: module:Interaction
list.description: This module contains various utility functions for interacting with elements on a web page. These functions include scrolling, clicking elements, and selecting options from dropdowns. The interactions are designed to simulate real user behavior with randomized actions such as scroll speeds and delays.

list.title: module:Interaction~clearInput
list.description: Clears the value of an input field by simulating keypress events (e.g., Backspace).

list.title: module:Interaction~clearInputBySelector
list.description: Clears the value of an input field using a CSS selector.

list.title: module:Interaction~clearInputByXpath
list.description: Clears the value of an input field using an XPath selector.

list.title: module:Interaction~clickElement
list.description:
Clicks an element using either a Selector or XPath selector.

This function retrieves the element, handles navigation based on the ISP (Hotmail or Gmail), and ensures the page is stable before proceeding.

list.title: module:Interaction~clickElementByXpath
list.description:
Clicks an element using an XPath selector.

This function ensures that navigation-related race conditions are avoided by setting up navigation detection before clicking.

list.title: module:Interaction~keyPress
list.description:
Simulates a key press event on a specified element.

This function focuses on the target element and presses the given key. Useful for triggering form submissions, navigating through inputs, or testing keyboard interactions.

list.title: module:Interaction~randomScroll
list.description: Scrolls the page randomly within a given duration and speed. This simulates human-like scrolling behavior by varying the scroll direction, amount, and delay.

list.title: module:Interaction~scrollToBottomPage
list.description: Scrolls the page to the bottom by incrementally scrolling down. This prevents the need for a fixed delay by continuously checking the scroll height and adjusting accordingly.

list.title: module:Interaction~scrollToElement
list.description: Randomly scrolls the page to a specific target element. The scrolling is performed with random delays and speeds to simulate human-like behavior. Once the target element is located, the page scrolls towards it and adjusts the scroll position based on an offset.

list.title: module:Interaction~selectOption
list.description:
Selects an option from a dropdown menu by its value.

This function uses Puppeteer's page.select() method to select an option in a dropdown element. It accepts either a CSS selector or an XPath to locate the dropdown and selects the desired option based on the provided value.

list.title: module:Interaction~typeText
list.description:
Types text into an input field using either a CSS selector or an XPath selector.

This function finds an input field and simulates typing into it, ensuring that the element remains focused. Supports multi-line text input, simulating Enter key presses when necessary.

list.title: module:Interaction~typeTextBySelector
list.description:
Types text into an input field using a CSS selector.

This function finds an input field using a CSS selector and simulates typing into it. Useful for filling out forms and simulating user input in automated tests.

list.title: module:Interaction~typeTextByXpath
list.description: Utility to type into an input field using Xpath selectors.

list.title: module:domUtils
list.description: This is domUtils.js

list.title: module:domUtils~checkElement
list.description: Checks if a specified element exists on the page.

list.title: module:domUtils~checkElementBySelector
list.description: Checks if a specified element by Selector exists on the page.

list.title: module:domUtils~checkElementByXpath
list.description: Checks if a specified element by Xpath exists on the page.

list.title: module:domUtils~fetchDOM
list.description:
Executes a given JavaScript callback in the context of the specified page.

This allows users to run arbitrary JavaScript code on the webpage represented by the Puppeteer page object. It captures the result of the callback execution and handles any errors that may occur during the process.

list.title: module:domUtils~getAttribute
list.description: Retrieves a specified attribute from an element on the page.

list.title: module:domUtils~getElement
list.description: Retrieves an element from the page based on a specified selector and type.
